@DumasRaphael @theindicator Cardiff and I did discussed data issues a little (although this didn't make the final version).   I suggested TSA and hotel data was probably the best (for different reasons).  We have to be more careful with data like Apple's and OpenTable.

@DumasRaphael @theindicator I linked to the Apple site for readers - I didn't explain how it worked on my site or during the brief discussion.   I did explain the data was relative to January 13th, and not seasonally adjusted.   If you misunderstood, here is the link to Apple's site:  https://t.co/sCv9qseEv3

@steveliesman @DianeSwonk The Apple data is compared to January 13th and is not seasonally adjusted.  People walk and drive more when the weather is nice, so I don't think walking and driving has returned to "normal" (we don't know the seasonal pattern).

Earlier I posted some Apple mobility data.  But the data isn't Seasonally adjusted, and people walk and drive more when the weather is nice.   So I'm just going to use their transit data.  Houston is off 52%.  NYC is off 78%.  US is off 67%.  https://t.co/jlUfKeVPAJ
